Значения

Ребенок, дитя

Мнемоника

У ребёнка темя зарастает раньше 旧, чем он пойдёт ножками 儿.

heisig_constituent: newborn babe, olden times, stick, sun, day, human legs
heisig_story: The top part of the kanji in this frame, you will remember, is the character for olden times, those days so old they needed a walking stick to get around. Western mythical imagination has old "Father Time" leaning on his sickle with a newborn babe crawling around his legs, the idea being that the circle of birth and-death goes on. This is the first of three times that the kanji for olden times will appear as a primitive element in another kanji, so try to make the most of it.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: newborn babe, child, young of animals
koohiiStory1: In the olden times, a newborn babe came out legs first.
koohiiStory2: Only 18 and already got a newborn babe. Young girls are so quick to spread their legs these days...　　　RTK2:　ジ　児童　じどう　(child)　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　ニ　小児　しょうに(infant).
jp_example_words:
児(こ): child, the young of animals
孤児(こじ): orphan
小児科(しょうにか): pediatrics
育児(いくじ): childcare, nursing, upbringing
児童(じどう): children, juvenile
幼児(ようじ): infant, baby, child
jp_readingExamples: 児童 (じどう), 幼児 (ようじ), 優良児 (ゆうりょうじ)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Pointing your magic solar powered wishing stick at the sun, you attain the legs of a child. You’re old and want young legs to carry you around, so you took your wishing stick that’s powered by the sun, and you wished for the legs of a child.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine yourself getting new legs. Legs that belong to a child. They’re limber and young and full of energy! Feel your legs of a child underneath you!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: As you delight in your new legs, Jesus (じ) descends from the sky. “My child,” he says, “why have you pointed the stick at the sun and wished for the legs of a child? You were already perfect, just as all of God’s children are perfect.”
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Say back to Jesus, “I’m not your child Jesus! And you’re just jealous of my new legs! You wish you had the legs of a child, Jesus! Your legs are like super old!” Actually say this out loud, and remember how Jesus wishes he could be a child again too.
Ru_Meaning: newborn babe, child, young of animals
Kanshudo_mnemonic: formerly (旧) just a pair of legs (儿), now a newborn babe

児字的基本解释

ér

児字的汉语字典释义

[①]［ér］
同“兒1”。
《宋元以来俗字谱》：“兒”，《列女传》、《通俗小说》、《三国志·平话》作“児”。按，亦为“兒”的日本用汉字。
[②]［ní］
同“兒2”。
《宋元以来俗字谱》：“兒”，《列女传》、《通俗小说》、《三国志·平话》作“児”。按，亦为“兒”的日本用汉字。

暂无。

ér
яп. вм. 儿
Radicals: 日, 儿  (sun, legs, stick)
Meaning Mnemonic
Pointing your magic solar powered wishing stick at the sun, you attain the legs of a child. You’re old and want young legs to carry you around, so you took your wishing stick that’s powered by the sun, and you wished for the legs of a child.
Imagine yourself getting new legs. Legs that belong to a child. They’re limber and young and full of energy! Feel your legs of a child underneath you!
Reading Mnemonic
As you delight in your new legs, Jesus (じ) descends from the sky. “My child,” he says, “why have you pointed the stick at the sun and wished for the legs of a child? You were already perfect, just as all of God’s children are perfect.”
Say back to Jesus, “I’m not your child Jesus! And you’re just jealous of my new legs! You wish you had the legs of a child, Jesus! Your legs are like super old!” Actually say this out loud, and remember how Jesus wishes he could be a child again too.
